hackathon-description-text: The world's best interdisciplinary hackathon, held at Caltech in Pasadena, CA! Meet hackers from all over the world and create projects to solve problems at the intersections of fields ranging from education to games/entertainment using anything from hardware to machine learning, all the while having a fantastic time.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Physics PhD Candidate @ University of Missouri

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the winning team receives a Surface Pro.
Each member of the winning team receives a Sphero R2-D2 App-Enabled Droid and a Disneyland Park experience (includes 2 tickets to Disneyland, and a VIP park experience).
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: [Disney] Best Hack Using Marvel API or Disney Open Source

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the winning team receives a Echo Spot.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: [SapientRazorfish] Best Use of a Conversational Interface

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The winning team receives a $1000 grant and mentorship to continue their project post-hackathon.
Each member of the winning team receives a $500 eBay gift card plus anything they make as an affiliate on the eBay Partner Network!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: [eBay] Best Hack for eBay APIs (and Earn $$ too!)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Each member of the winning team receives an Amazon Echo.
Each member of the winning team will receive a quadcopter drone with a 720p HD camera.
Each member of the winning team will receive an Amazon Fire HD 8.
Each member of the winning team will receive a mechanical keyboard. Sponsored by AWS.
Each member of the winning team will receive a drawing tablet.
Each member of the winning team receives a $50 Steam gift card.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: DragonBoard 410C + power source for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=293 S Holliston Ave, Pasadena, CA 91125, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How usable is your hack in its current state? Strive to create a functioning project even if it doesn't have a ton of features!
Does your hack combine principles from across different fields? Live up to our theme and make a hack that explore the intersection of computer science with other fields!
How creative is your hack? Try to approach the problem you are trying to solve from a novel angle!
Is your hack polished? Create a hack that looks as great as it functions!

hackathon-location-address: 293 S Holliston Ave, Pasadena, CA 91125, USA
hackathon-description-header: The world's best interdisciplinary hackathon - Hacktech!
